noun.description: A particular part or feature of something.
examples: the financial aspect can be overstressed

noun.description: The positioning of a building or thing in a specified direction.
examples: a greenhouse with a southern aspect

noun.description: A grammatical category or form that expresses the way in which time is denoted by the verb.
examples: the semantics of tense and aspect

verb.description: (of a planet) form an aspect with (another celestial body)
examples: the sun is superbly aspected by your ruler Mars on the 19th

origin: Late Middle English (denoting the action or a way of looking): from Latin aspectus, from aspicere look at, from ad- to, at + specere to look.
